column3: Changing old release notes makes no sense IMO and stuff like this leads to "pull-request-overview pollution".\n
Sometimes we change release notes when an issue is discovered shortly after release, but I don't think fixing _0.4.0_ release notes helps anyone.\n

Yes, 0.4.0 is ancient. Let's not mess with historical documents like this...

Thanks for trying to help, but it would be much more helpful to correct e.g. language in the the RPC help or build documents.

@s-matthew-english If you are looking for small things to help out with, you can
- search through the [easy to implement](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues?q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aopen+label%3A%22Easy+to+implement%22) issues.
- write tests to improve the coverage (both unit tests and rpc tests are welcome)
- help with review and testing (There are easy ones such as the [gui](https://github.co

:/ I checked out the gui and rpc issues, I feel like I don't understand the code well enough yet to contribute in a good way there.\n\nmy idea was to bootstrap my knowledge of the code, and my ability to work with git by reading through the comments and initially just making some small improvements, do you think, if I avoided the old release notes, that it could be something useful? the last thing
